definition.text: I mentioned earlier there are two charts in this workspace. In Superalgos, we call each of these a Time Machine.

paragraphs.text: A time machine may hold one Timeline Chart or more. We call them time machines because all timeline charts within a time machine are synchronized in time. This feature of time machines allows to superimpose different layers of data sharing the same Time Scale.
Hover your mouse pointer over the time machines!
Notice the label emerging on the left-hand side showing which exchanges and markets the data is associated with. A single time machine may hold data from multiple markets and multiple exchanges!
